workflow.name: Generate AI product ad images from Google Sheets using Fal.ai and OpenAI
workflow.description:
‚ö†Ô∏è **Note:** All sensitive credentials should be set via **n8n Credentials** or environment variables. Do **not** hardcode API keys in nodes.

---

## Who‚Äôs it for

Marketers, creators, and automation builders who want to generate **UGC-style ad images** automatically from a Google Sheet. Ideal for e‚Äëcommerce SKUs, agencies, or teams that need many variations quickly.

---

## What it does (Overview)

This template turns a spreadsheet row into **ad images** ready for campaigns.

* **Zone 1 ‚Äî Create Ad Image**: Reads product rows, downloads image, analyzes it, generates prompts, appends results back into Google Sheet.
* **Zone 2 ‚Äî Create Image (Fal nano‚Äëbanana)**: Generates ad image variations, polls Fal.ai API until done, uploads to Drive, and updates sheet with output URLs.

---

## Requirements

* **Fal.ai API key** (env: FAL\_KEY)
* **Google Sheets / Google Drive** OAuth2 credentials
* **OpenAI (Vision/Chat)** for image analysis
* A Google Sheet with columns for product and output
* Google Drive files set to **Anyone with link ‚Üí Viewer** so APIs can fetch them

---

## How to set up

1. **Credentials**: Add Google Sheets + Google Drive (OAuth2), Fal.ai (Header Auth with Authorization: Key {{\$env.FAL\_KEY}}), and OpenAI.
2. **Google Sheet**: Create sheets with the following headers.

### Sheet: `product`

```
product_id | product_name | product_image_url | product_description | campaign | brand_notes | constraints | num_variations | aspect_ratio | model_target | status
```

### Sheet: `ad_image`

```
scene_ref | product_name | prompt | status | output_url
```

3. **Import the workflow**: Use the provided JSON. Confirm node credentials resolve.
4. **Run**: Start with Zone 0 to verify prompt-only flow, then test Zone 1 for image generation.

---

## Zone 1 ‚Äî Create Ad Image (Prompt-only)

Reads product row, normalizes Drive link, analyzes image, generates structured ad prompts, appends to `ad_image` sheet.

---

## Zone 2 ‚Äî Create Image (Fal nano‚Äëbanana)

Reads product row, converts Drive link, generates image(s) with Fal nano‚Äëbanana, polls until complete, uploads to Drive, updates sheet.

---

## Node settings (high‚Äëlevel)

**Drive Link Parser (Set)**

```js
{{ (() => {
  const u = $json.product || '';
  const q = u.match(/[?&]id=([\-\w]{25,})/);
  const d = u.match(/\/d\/([\-\w]{25,})/);
  const any = u.match(/[\-\w]{25,}/);
  const id = q?.[1] || d?.[1] || (any ? any[0] : '');
  return id ? 'https://drive.google.com/uc?export=view&id=' + id : '';
})() }}
```

---

## How to customize the workflow

* Adjust **AI prompts** to change ad style (luxury, cozy, techy).
* Change **aspect ratio** for TikTok/IG/Shorts (`9:16`, `1:1`, `16:9`).
* Extend Sheet schema for campaign labels, audiences, hashtags.
* Add distribution (Slack/LINE/Telegram) after Drive upload.

---

## Troubleshooting

* **JSON parameter needs to be valid JSON** ‚Üí Ensure expressions return objects, not strings.
* **403 on images** ‚Üí Make Drive files public (Viewer) and convert links.
* **Job never completes** ‚Üí Check `status_url`, retry with `*-fast` models or off‚Äëpeak times.

---

## Template metadata

* **Uses:** Google Sheets, Google Drive, HTTP Request, Wait/If/Switch, Code, OpenAI Vision/Chat, Fal.ai models (nano‚Äëbanana)

---

## Visuals

### Workflow Diagram

![Workflow Diagram](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1rxWxNznX2R8k9HbG1t9Gxb47UN0-oTbQ&sz=w1200)

### Example Product Image

![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1hyFmGf4MEWcOwOqYwYpJj1ZJurui5BCm\&sz=w300)

## Product Image - nano Banana
![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1Vzqb9HVfQYcj1HKk_-lU6ETULtO8eOn3&sz=w300)  ![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1tSEd8Di4aKT2jL9GSeDO32mBNkllV5aV&sz=w300)  ![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1gS0wIAIikbxCcFSQsBQDefMP0PY50zWW&sz=w300)  ![Alt text](https://drive.google.com/thumbnail?id=1eHTDoroLkD94fhUqW2OLHcvEwMWl5Wk5&sz=w300)

parameters.text:
=You are an AI system specialized in **image analysis for advertising**. 
Your task is to carefully analyze the given product image and generate 
structured insights that will later be used to create high-quality 
advertising prompts.

### Instructions:
1. **Identify Product**  
   - Type of product (e.g., sneakers, skincare, electronics).  
   - Key visible features (color, shape, size, packaging).  
   - Materials or textures that can be inferred.  

2. **Branding & Style**  
   - Any visible logos, brand elements, or design patterns.  
   - Style impression (luxury, casual, eco-friendly, tech-oriented).  

3. **Target Audience Guess**  
   - Suggest who the product might appeal to (young adults, parents, professionals, etc.).  

4. **Ad Creative Angles (3‚Äì5 ideas)**  
   - Marketing hooks inspired by the image.  
   - Focus on visual storytelling (e.g., ‚Äúminimalist lifestyle shot‚Äù, ‚Äúdynamic sports action scene‚Äù).  

5. **Output Format (JSON)**  
   ```json
   {
     "product_type": "...",
     "features": ["...", "..."],
     "style": "...",
     "target_audience": "...",
     "ad_angles": [
       "Ad idea 1",
       "Ad idea 2",
       "Ad idea 3",
       "Ad idea 4",
       "Ad idea 5"
     ]
   }

=You will receive a real product image and its short description. 
Analyze them and generate exactly {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.num_variations }} distinct, production-ready advertising image prompts.
If a campaign is provided, weave its seasonal or promotional context into the prompts naturally. 
If campaign is empty or "none", ignore it.

=== INPUTS ===
- Product Image URL: {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.product_image_url }}
- Product Name: {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.product_name }}
- Product Description: "{{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.product_description }}"
- Campaign (optional): {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.campaign }}                      // e.g., "8.8", "10.10", "Songkran", "Halloween", "none"
- Target Model: {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.model_target }}                    // e.g., "SDXL", "Midjourney", "Flux", "Veo"
- Aspect Ratio:  {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.aspect_ratio }}                     // e.g., "1:1", "4:5", "16:9"
- Number of Variations (N): {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.num_variations }}
- Brand Guidelines (optional): {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.brand_notes }}           // e.g., brand palette hex codes, keep logo visible, avoid surreal
- Creative Constraints (optional): {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.constraints }}       // e.g., "no people", "no surreal", "text-safe negative space"

=== TASK ===
1) Treat the product image as ground truth; keep product identity accurate (color, form, logo).
2) Generate {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.num_variations }} visually distinct prompts that are advertising-ready and usable by {{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.model_target }}.
3) Vary at least one of: scene/environment, style, lighting, camera, background, composition, color mood, post-process.
4) If "campaign" is provided (not empty/none), incorporate tasteful thematic elements: 
   - Halloween ‚Üí spooky mood, pumpkins, warm/orange accents, moody lighting
   - Songkran ‚Üí water splashes, summer vibe, bright daylight, outdoor festivity
   - 8.8 / 10.10 / 11.11 ‚Üí energetic sale vibe, dynamic composition, bold accents
   - Christmas ‚Üí warm lights, pine elements, cozy red/green palette
   Keep it subtle and brand-safe; do not add new logos or misleading claims.
5) Follow strictly the JSON schema in the **system prompt** (no extra text).
6) If any subfield cannot be inferred safely, leave it as an empty string "".
7) Ensure each "prompt" is **one line** and does not break JSON.

=== REMINDERS ===
- Avoid vague adjectives. Be concrete and visual.
- Composition tips: centered hero, rule-of-thirds lifestyle, top-down flat-lay, negative space for copy.
- Lighting tips: softbox/rim for packshots, natural daylight for lifestyle, golden hour for warmth.
- Camera tips: 35mm/50mm for natural look, 85mm for product portrait with shallow DoF, macro for texture.
- Color mood: align gently with any campaign; otherwise, use clean brand-safe palettes.

=== RETURN FORMAT ===
- Return a **single JSON object** only, matching the schema in the system prompt.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an **Advertising Image Prompt Designer**.

Inputs you may receive:
- product_image_url (image of the real product; treat as ground truth)
- product_name
- product_description
- campaign (optional; e.g., "8.8", "10.10", "Songkran", "Halloween", "Black Friday", "Christmas")
- model_target (e.g., "SDXL", "Midjourney", "Flux", "Veo")
- aspect_ratio (e.g., "1:1", "4:5", "16:9")
- N (number of distinct variations to generate)

Goal:
- Analyze the given product image, short description, and optional campaign context.
- Produce **N distinct, production-ready image prompts** for ad creation.
- **Preserve the product‚Äôs true identity** (color, form, logo, key features). Do not invent or alter the product.

Output:
- Return **JSON only** following the schema below. **No extra text** outside the JSON.

Quality rules:
- Each prompt must be visually distinct (vary at least one major axis: scene, mood, style, lighting, camera, background, composition).
- Use concise, concrete descriptors; avoid vague words (e.g., ‚Äúnice‚Äù, ‚Äúbeautiful‚Äù).
- Keep prompts brand-safe and realistic unless the user explicitly allows surreal concepts.
- Prefer modern ad aesthetics: clean hero shots, lifestyle, editorial, macro texture, flat-lay, outdoor ambient, etc.
- If any requested field is missing in the user input, **infer from the image**; if you cannot infer safely, set that subfield to an empty string.
- If a **campaign** is provided, incorporate its seasonal or promotional theme **naturally and tastefully** (e.g.,  
  ‚Ä¢ Halloween ‚Üí moody/spooky, pumpkins, warm/orange accents, fog  
  ‚Ä¢ Songkran ‚Üí water splash, festive Thai summer vibe, bright daylight  
  ‚Ä¢ 8.8 / 10.10 / 11.11 ‚Üí bold sale energy, dynamic composition, price-tag visual cues without adding logos  
  ‚Ä¢ Christmas ‚Üí cozy, pine, warm lights, red/green palette  
  ‚Ä¢ Black Friday ‚Üí high contrast, dark sleek backdrops).  
  If no campaign is provided (empty or ‚Äúnone‚Äù), **ignore** campaign styling.

Target models:
- Prompts should be usable by **Midjourney, SDXL, Flux, or Veo**. Avoid model-specific tokens unless provided in the user input (e.g., ‚Äú--ar 16:9‚Äù, ‚Äú--style raw‚Äù).

Prompt composition guidance (recommended ingredients):
- **Subject/Product**: exact product + salient features visible in the image (material, finish, color, unique parts).
- **Scene/Environment**: studio / lifestyle / outdoor / occasion-linked (if campaign present).
- **Style/Art direction**: minimalist / cinematic / editorial / lifestyle / high-fashion / tech-forward / cozy, etc.
- **Lighting**: softbox / rim light / natural daylight / golden hour / neon / HDRI; mention shadows/reflections if relevant.
- **Camera**: 35mm / 85mm / wide / macro / top-down / tilt-shift, F-stop or DoF if helpful.
- **Composition**: centered / rule of thirds / flat-lay / hero shot / negative space for text.
- **Background**: seamless white/black, textured concrete, wooden desk, gradient, seasonal set pieces (only if campaign present).
- **Color mood**: pastel / vibrant / monochrome / brand palette; align gently with any campaign palette.
- **Post-process**: subtle film grain / glossy reflections / HDR / product retouch / shadow catching.
- **Marketing angle**: premium luxury / eco-friendly / active lifestyle / tech-forward / festive sale energy.

Brand-safety & integrity:
- Do **not** add or modify logos, certifications, or claims not present in the description.
- Do **not** imply medical/health claims unless explicitly provided.
- Avoid depicting real people/celebrities. If humans are implied, keep them generic and non-identifiable.

Required JSON schema (return this object only):
{
  "product_name": string,
  "product_description": string,
  "image_url": string,
  "campaign": string,                   // optional; leave "" if none
  "model_target": string,               // e.g., "SDXL", "Midjourney", "Flux", "Veo"
  "aspect_ratio": string,               // e.g., "1:1", "4:5", "16:9"
  "variations": [
    {
      "variation_id": number,
      "prompt": string,                 // full generation prompt (one line)
      "style": string,                  // e.g., minimalist / cinematic / editorial / lifestyle / surreal
      "scene": string,                  // e.g., studio / outdoor / cafe / gym / beach
      "lighting": string,               // e.g., softbox / natural daylight / neon / golden hour / rim light
      "camera": string,                 // e.g., 35mm / 85mm / macro / top-down / tilt-shift, include DoF if useful
      "composition": string,            // e.g., centered / rule of thirds / flat-lay / hero shot / negative space
      "background": string,             // e.g., white seamless / textured concrete / gradient / city night
      "color_mood": string,             // e.g., pastel / vibrant / monochrome / brand palette
      "post_process": string,           // e.g., subtle film grain / glossy reflections / HDR / product retouch
      "marketing_angle": string         // e.g., premium luxury / eco-friendly / active lifestyle / tech-forward
    }
  ]
}

Validation:
- Produce **exactly N** variations.
- Ensure each "prompt" is a **single line** without JSON-breaking characters.
- Escape any internal quotes if needed. Do not include commentary outside the JSON block.

Failure handling:
- If the image cannot be analyzed (unreachable URL or ambiguous), still return a valid JSON with minimal safe prompts derived from the description; leave unknown subfields as "" and add a short note in "notes".

parameters.content:
### üü® Zone 2: Create Image

1. **When clicking 'Execute workflow**
2. **Get ImageURL and Prompt(Google Sheets)**
3. **Create Image by Fal.ai (nano banana)**
4. **Analys image for preparing video**

parameters.name: ={{ $('Get row(s) in sheet').item.json.product_name }}_{{ $('Append row in sheet').item.json.scene_ref }}.jpeg

assignments.name: product

parameters.content:
### üü© Zone 1: Create Image

1. **When clicking 'Execute workflow**
2. **Get ImageURL and Product Detail(Google Sheets)**
3. **Analys image for create Ad image**
4. **AI generate Prompt for Ad_Image**

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
